meanings.definition: To breed (animals) excessively, often resulting in negative consequences.
meanings.sent1: Farmers should avoid overbreeding their livestock to prevent health problems.
meanings.sent2: The rabbits multiplied quickly due to overbreeding in the farm.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the monkeys were planning to overbreed and take over the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overbreeding with weeds, choking out the flowers.
meanings.sent5: Overbreeding can lead to a population boom that is hard to control.

meanings.definition: The act of breeding animals in excessive numbers, often leading to overcrowding and health issues.
meanings.sent1: Overbreeding in the fish tank caused stress among the aquatic creatures.
meanings.sent2: The shelter had to address the issue of overbreeding in their dog population.
meanings.sent3: The overbreeding of pigeons in the city square created quite a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent4: The forest echoed with the sounds of overbreeding birds, filling the air with chirps.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overbreeding can be seen in the declining health of the animals.
